English: The facility must respect the residents right to personal privacy, including the right to privacy in his or her oral (that is, spoken), written, and electronic communications, including the right to send and promptly receive unopened mail and other letters, packages and other materials delivered to the facility for the resident, including those delivered through a means other than a postal service

English: The facility must inform each resident before, or at the time of admission, and periodically during the resident�s stay, of services available in the facility and of charges for those services, including any charges for services not covered under Medicare/ Medicaid or by the facility�s per diem rate

English: The facility must display in the facility written information, and provide to residents and applicants for admission, oral and written information about how to apply for and use Medicare and Medicaid benefits, and how to receive refunds for previous payments covered by such benefits

English: The facility shall exercise reasonable care for the protection of the resident�s property from loss or theft

English: The facility must inform each Medicaid-eligible resident, in writing, at the time of admission to the nursing facility and when the resident becomes eligible for Medicaid of�

English: The facility must discuss the alternative physician participation with the resident and honor the resident�s preferences, if any, among options

English: The facility must refund to the resident or resident representative any and all refunds due the resident within 30 days from the resident�s date of discharge from the facility

English: The facility must protect and facilitate that resident�s right to communicate with individuals and entities within and external to the facility, including reasonable access to:

English: The facility must protect and promote the rights of the resident

English: The facility must provide a designated staff person who is approved by the resident or family group and the facility and who is responsible for providing assistance and responding to written requests that result from group meetings.

Hmong: Lub tsev tu yuav tsum tsim kom muaj thiab siv ib txoj cai tswj cov kev txais nkag

English: The facility must deposit any residents� personal funds in excess of $100 in an interest bearing account (or accounts) that is separate from any of the facility�s operating accounts, and that credits all interest earned on resident�s funds to that account.

English: The facility must ensure that the resident can exercise his or her rights without interference, coercion, discrimination, or reprisal from the facility

Hmong: Lub tsev tu yuav tsum txhob cia tus neeg sawv cev muaj cai los txiav txim rau tus neeg mob dhau rau qib uas lub tsev hais plaub tso cai los sis tus neeg nyob tso cai
English: The facility shall not extend the resident representative the right to make decisions on behalf of the resident beyond the extent required by the court or delegated by the resident

English: The facility must not require residents to deposit their personal funds with the facility.

English: The facility must not require a resident to request any item or service as a condition of admission or continued stay

Hmong: Lub tsev tu yuav tsum txhob muaj ib qho nqi nplua rau ib tug nrrg mob cov nyiaj ntiag tug rau ib yam twg los sis kev pab twg los xij uas Medicaid los sis Medicare kam them (tsuav txhob yog cov nyiaj xub kom them los sis them ua ke)
English: The facility must not impose a charge against the personal funds of a resident for any item or service for which payment is made under Medicaid or Medicare (except for applicable deductible and coinsurance amounts)

English: The facility must treat the decisions of a resident representative as the decisions of the resident to the extent required by the court or delegated by the resident

English: The facility must consider the views of a resident or family group and act promptly upon the grievances and recommendations of such groups concerning issues of resident care and life in the facility.

Hmong: Lub tsev tu yuav tsum xyuas zoo kom txhua tus neeg mob paub lub npe, hom kev txawj kho, thiab ib txoj kev cuag tau nrog tus kws kho mob thiab lwm tus kws kho uas muaj lub luag hauj lwm rau nws kev tu kho
English: The facility must ensure that each resident remains informed of the name, specialty, and way of contacting the physician and other primary care professionals responsible for his or her care

Hmong: Lub tsev tu yuav tsum:

Tus kab mob qhua maj qhua pias sib kis tau yooj yim heev los ntawm kev chwv cov hlwv qhua maj qhua pias los sis los dhau los ntawm cov cua thaum ib tug neeg muaj mob qhua maj qhua pias hnoos los sis txham
English: Chickenpox spreads very easily by touching chickenpox blisters or through the air when someone with chickenpox coughs or sneezes

Hmong: Tus Kab Mob Siab Hom B yog dab tsi?
Tus Kab Mob Siab Hom B yog tus kab mob siab uas tshwm sim los ntawm ib tug kab mob vais lav
English: Hepatitis B is a liver disease caused by a virus

Hmong: Tus kab mob TB tsis huam yog dab tsi?
Tus kab mob tshiab no tseem tab tom raug kuaj xyuas kom paub ntxiv
English: The spectrum of illness is still being described for this new disease

Hmong: tus kab mob ua rau yus zoo siab muaj zog heev, tu siab qaug zog heev
Tus kab mob vais lav flavivirus yog txheeb ze rau tus kab mob vais lav ua qoob liab (dengue) thiab tus kab mob vais lav ua npaws daj
English: The virus is a flavivirus, closely related to dengue virus and yellow fever virus

Hmong: Tus kab mob vais lav Jamestown Canyon yog dabtsi?
English: What is Jamestown Canyon virus disease?

Hmong: Tus kab mob vais lav Jamestown Canyon yog ib hom kab mob vais lav uas sib kis rau cov neeg los ntawm raug yoov qaib muaj kab mob tom
English: Jamestown Canyon virus disease is an illness that is transmitted to people through the bite of an infected mosquito

Hmong: Tus kab mob vais lav kis tau los ntawm kev sib chwv ncaj qha nrog cov kua dej los ntawm cov hlwv dej ntawm cov pob liab-liab
English: The virus is spread through direct contact with fluid from the blisters of the rash

Hmong: Tus kab mob vais lav no muab tis npe hu lawv qab lub zos Powassan, Ontario uas xub thawj nrhiav pom muaj nyob rau xyoo 1958
English: The virus is named after Powassan, Ontario where it was first discovered in 1958

Hmong: Tus kab mob vais lav no raug tshawb pom muaj thawj zaug rau xyoo 1961 nyob hauv cov yoov qaib los ntawm Jamestown Canyon, xeev Colorado
English: The virus was first identified in 1961 in mosquitoes from Jamestown Canyon, Colorado

Hmong: Tus kab mob vais lav no yog ib tug kab mob alphavirus (kab mob tom hlwb) thiab txheeb ze rau cov vais lav kab mob hlwb o ntawm nees sab hnub poob thiab cov kab mob hlwb o ntawm nees Venezuelen
English: The virus is an alphavirus and is closely related to western equine encephalitis and Venezuelan equine encephalitis viruses

Hmong: Tus kab mob vais lav no yog ib tug kab mob alphavirus thiab txheeb ze rau cov vais lav kab mob hlwb o ntawm nees sab hnub tuaj thiab cov kab mob hlwb ob ntawm nees Venezuelen
English: The virus is an alphavirus and is closely related to eastern equine encephalitis and Venezuelan equine encephalitis viruses

Hmong: Tus kab mob vais lav no yuav nyob tsis taus ntev ntawm daim ntawv nqaij
English: The virus does not live long on surfaces

Hmong: Tus kab mob vais lav ntawm tus kab mob hlwb ob ntawm nees sab hnub tuaj yog raug tsim los ntawm cov yoov qaib thiab tej noog Culiseta melanura
English: Eastern equine encephalitis virus is maintained in a cycle involving Culiseta melanura mosquitoes and birds

Hmong: Tus kab mob vais lav Powassan yog dabtsi?
Tus kab mob vais lav West Nile loj hlob rau ntawm cov yoov qaib thiab tej noog
English: West Nile virus is maintained in a cycle involving mosquitoes and birds

Hmong: Tus kab mob vais lav West Nile txaus ntshai npaum li cas?

Hmong: Tus kab mob vais lav West Nile yog dabtsi?

Hmong: Tus kab mob vais lav West Nile yog ib hom kab mob vais lav uas kis raws tibneeg los ntawm raug yoov qaib muaj kab mob tom
English: West Nile virus disease is a viral illness that is transmitted most commonly to people through the bite of an infected mosquito

Hmong: Tus kab uas ua rau mob COVID-19 tseem sib kis thiab mob rau cov neeg hauv Minnesota thiab thoob plaws lub ntiaj teb
English: The virus that causes COVID-19 infections continues to spread, affecting people in Minnesota and throughout the world

Hmong: Tus kab zuam yuav tsum tom dhos nkaus daim tawv nqaij ntawm ib tus neeg ntev li 12-24 xaub moos ua ntej nws mam kis cov kab mob npes taws lias ntawd tau rau ib tus tibneeg twg
English: The tick must be attached to a person for at least 12-24 hours before it can spread the bacteria

Hmong: Tus kab zuam yuav tsum tom dhos nkaus daim tawv nqaij ntawm ib tus neeg ua ntej nws mam kis cov kab mob ntawd tau rau ib tug neeg twg

English: Your public health worker may need to check the airflow in your home or other places you spend time

English: The patient has the right to not be subjected to discrimination or reprisal for exercising his or her rights

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj cai koom rau tsev neeg cov pawg neeg
English: The resident has a right to participate in family groups.

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj cai siv thiab khaws yam khoom uas yog nws tug tsuav yog muaj chaw txaus cia tej khoom, thiab tsis cuam tshuam rau lwm tus neeg txoj cai los sis tsis txhob muaj daim ntawv txwv tsis pub khaws tej khoom ntawd tsam muaj teeb meem raug mob rau neeg.
English: Patients may retain and use their personal clothing and possessions as space permits, unless to do so would infringe upon rights of other patients, and unless medically or programmatically contraindicated for documented medical, safely, or programmatic reasons.

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj cai ua pab rau lub tsev tu, yog nws ho yeem, thaum---
English: The resident may perform services for the facility, if he or she chooses, when�

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj ib txoj cai kom muaj tsev neeg tus (cov) neeg los sis nws tus (cov) neeg sawv cev sib ntsib nyob rau lub tsev tu nrog cov tsev neeg los sis tus (cov) neeg sawv cev ntawm lwm tus neeg mob nyob rau lub tsev tu.
English: The resident has a right to have family member(s) or other resident representative(s) meet in the facility with the families or resident representative(s) of other residents in the facility.

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj ib txoj cai kom tau kev kho uas muaj kev hwm thiab kev meej mom zoo, uas muaj:
English: The resident has a right to be treated with respect and dignity, including:

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj ib txoj cai los ceev nws cov ntaub ntawv ntawm tus kheej thiab kev kho mob uas tsis pub qhia tawm
English: The resident has a right to secure and confidential personal and medical records

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj ib txoj cai los koom nyob rau lwm yam uas muaj rau ua, uas muaj kev poo nrog lwm tus, kev teev ntseeg, thiab zej zos kev muaj rau ua uas tsis cov nyom rau lwm tus neeg mob nyob rau lub tsev tu cov cai.
English: The resident has a right to participate in other activities, including social, religious, and community activities that do not interfere with the rights of other residents in the facility.

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj ib txoj cai los npaj thiab koom rau cov pawg neeg mob nyob rau lub tsev tu.
English: The resident has a right to organize and participate in resident groups in the facility.

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj ib txoj cai los tos txais qhua tuaj xyuas uas nws tus kheej xaiv nyob rau lub sij hawm uas nws tus kheej xaiv, uas cia tus neeg mob tsis pub tuaj xyuas thaum tsim nyog, thiab ua ib hom kev uas tsis cuam tshuam dab tsi txog lwm tus neeg mob ib leeg twg cov cai.
English: The resident has a right to receive visitors of his or her choosing at the time of his or her choosing, subject to the resident�s right to deny visitation when applicable, and in a manner that does not impose on the rights of another resident.

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj ib txoj cai los xaiv ua los sis tsis kam ua tej yam pab rau lub tsev tu thiab lub tsev tu yuav tsum txhob kom ib tug neeg mob ua dab tsi pab rau lub tsev tu.
English: The resident has a right to choose to or refuse to perform services for the facility and the facility must not require a resident to perform services for the facility.

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj ib txoj cai sib cuag sib poo nrogzej zos tej tswv cuab thiab koom rau zej zos tej kev muaj ua nyob rau thiab tawm ntawm lub tsev tu mus
English: The resident has a right to interact with members of the community and participate in community activities both inside and outside the facility

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj ib txoj cai tau ib lub neej tau kev hwm, txiv txim yus kheej, thiab sib tham sib xyuas tau nrog lwm tus neeg thiab cov kev pab nyob rau hauv thiab tawm ntawm lub tsev tu mus:
English: The resident has a right to a dignified existence, self- determination, and communication with and access to persons and services inside and outside the facility:

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj ib txoj cai tau ib qho chaw nyob uas nyab xeeb, huv, xix nyob thias xws li vaj tse, muaj nrog tiam sis tsis tas rau kom tau kev kho thiab txhawb rau kev ua neej nyob ib hnub dhau ib hnub uas nyab xeeb
English: The resident has a right to a safe, clean, comfortable and homelike environment, including but not limited to receiving treatment and supports for daily living safely

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj ib txoj cai tau kev npog tsis qhia thiab tsis pub qhia tawm nws tus kheej cov ntaub ntawv kho mob
English: The resident has a right to personal privacy and confidentiality of his or her personal and medical records

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj ib txoj cai xaiv tej yam muaj rau ua, cov sij hawm npaj ua (nrog rau sij hawm pw thiab mus kev), cov kws kho mob thiab kev kho mob uas dhos rau nws cov kev nyiam, kev ntsuam xyuas tau los, kev npaj tu kho thiab lwm yam kev pab uas muaj nyob rau feem no.
English: The resident has a right to choose activities, schedules (including sleeping and waking times), health care and providers of health care services consistent with his or her interests, assessments, plan of care and other applicable provisions of this part.

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj txoj cai cia ib tug neeg uas tus neeg mob tau xaiv los sawv cev ua tus neeg saib xyuas txog kev kho mob tuaj xyuas nws raws li hauv tshooj 145C thiab txoj cai cia tus neeg uas tus neeg mob tau xaiv tuaj xyuas thiab txiav txim hauv cov kev kho mob raws li hauv nqe 22
English: The patient has the right to visitation by an individual the patient has appointed as the patient�s health care agent under chapter 145C and the right to visitation and health care decision making by an individual designated by the patient under paragraph 22

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj txoj cai hais rau lawv txog tej yam nws tsis txaus siab thiab nrog tau lawv tuav tswv yim txog kev yuav hloov kho tus mob. Yuav tsis pub muaj leej twg txwv cheem nws, cuam tshuam, yuam kom ua thiab saib tsis taus nws los puas hawv yuav tshem nws tawm
English: Patients may voice grievances and recommend changes in policies and services to facility staff and others of their choice, free from restraint, interference, coercion, discrimination, or reprisal, including threat of discharge

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj txoj cai kom qhia paub txog nws cov cai thiab tag nrho cov cai tswj thiab kev cai kav rau neeg mob kev coj thiab cov luag hauj lwm thaum nws nyob rau lub tsev tu
English: The resident has the right to be informed of his or her rights and of all rules and regulations governing resident conduct and responsibilities during his or her stay in the facility

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj txoj cai kom qhia paub txog, thiab koom rau, nws kev kho, uas muaj:
English: The resident has the right to be informed of, and participate in, his or her treatment, including:

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj txoj cai los---
English: The resident has the right to�

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj txoj cai los qhia cov kev tsis haum siab tawm rau lub tsev tu los sis lwm lub koom haum los sis chaw pab uas mloog xyuas txog cov kev tsis haum siab es kom txhob raug ntxub ntxaug los sis raug ua pauj thiab kom ho txhob ntshai ta am muaj kev ntxub ntxaug los sis kev ua pauj
English: The resident has the right to voice grievances to the facility or other agency or entity that hears grievances without discrimination or reprisal and without fear of discrimination or reprisal

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj txoj cai los xaiv nws tus kws saib xyuas kho.
English: The resident has the right to choose his or her attending physician.

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj txoj cai loss iv nws cov cai tam ib tug neeg nyob rau lub tsev tu thiab tam ib tug pej xeem los sis neeg nyob Asmeskas.
English: The resident has the right to exercise his or her rights as a resident of the facility and as a citizen or resident of the United States.

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj txoj cai siv tau ib lub xov tooj kom tsim nyog, uas muaj nrog rau cov kev pab TTY thiab TDD, thiab ib qho chaw nyob rau lub chaw uas hut ham tau es tsis muaj tus hnov
English: The resident has the right to have reasonable access to the use of a telephone, including TTY and TDD services, and a place in the facility where calls can be made without being overheard

English: The resident has the right to and the facility must make prompt efforts by the facility to resolve grievances the resident may have, in accordance with this paragraph

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj txoj cai tau thiab lub tsev tu yuav tsum txhawb thiab pab kom muaj kev txiav txim-tus kheej los ntawm kev pab uas tus neeg mob xaiv, uas muaj tiam sis tsis tas rau cov cai hauv qab no:
English: The resident has the right to and the facility must promote and facilitate resident selfdetermination through support of resident choice, including but not limited to the following rights:

English: Individuals have the right to refuse this information

English: The resident has the right to refuse the release of personal and medical records except as provided under applicable federal or state laws

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj txoj cai tsis muaj tus los txuam los pom nyob rau nws cov kev sib tham sib cuag siv hluav taws xob xws li siv email thiab pom duab yees sib tham thiab rau kev siv Internet los tshawb fawb
English: The resident has the right to have reasonable access to and privacy in their use of electronic communications such as email and video communications and for Internet research

Hmong: Tus neeg mob muaj txoj cai tsis raug txwv txheem, yuam, ntxub ntxaug, thiab raug ua pauj los ntawm lub tsev tu nyob rau nws kev siv nws cov cai thiab kom tau kev txhawb los ntawm lub tsev tu nyob rau nws kev siv nws cov cai
English: The resident has the right to be free of interference, coercion, discrimination, and reprisal from the facility in exercising his or her rights and to be supported by the facility in the exercise of his or her rights

English: However, chickenpox is now less common, and is often difficult to differentiate between other rash illnesses, such as hand, foot, and mouth disease

English: However, shingles can sometimes be confused with herpes simplex virus, or other rash illnesses

Hmong: Txawm li cas los xij, tej tsos mob uas nquag hais qhia los txog niaj hnub tam sim no muaj xws li: Ua npaws lossis tshee Mob taubhau Mob thooj leeg nqaij Sab heev lossis tsis muaj zog Zoo ib yam li kev ua mob npaws sib taug lw los ntawm kab zuam tom, qee cov neeg mob muaj mob vim B. miyamotoi rov qab tshwm sim cov yeeb yam mob ua ntej yuav kuaj xyuas thiab kho
English: However, the most common symptoms reported to date include: Fever or chills Headache Muscle aches Tiredness or weakness Similar to tickborne relapsing fever, some patients with illness due to B. miyamotoi have described recurring symptoms prior to diagnosis and treatment

Hmong: Txawm li cas los xij, tej tsos mob uas nquag hais qhia los txog niaj hnub tam sim no muaj xws li: Ua npaws lossis tshee Mob thooj leeg nqaij lossis mob pob qij txha Mob taubhau Nqaij ua pob xoo Zoo ib yam li tus kab mob Lyme uas tshwm sim los ntawm B. burgdorferi, kev mob pob tes (pob qij txhaj nruj thiab o liab) kuj pom tshwm sim rau cov neeg muaj mob ntev mus los ntawm B. mayonii
English: However, the most common symptoms reported to date include: Fever or chills Muscle or joint pain Headache Rash Similar to Lyme disease caused by B. burgdorferi, arthritis (joint inflammation and swelling) has also been reported as a later stage of infection in patients with illnesses due to B. mayonii

Hmong: Txawm li cas los xij, tus kab mob no tuaj yeem ua rau muaj teeb meem muaj mob loj rau cov neeg laus, me nyuam mos, thiab cov hluas, nrog rau cov neeg uas cev xeeb tub los sis lub cev tsis muaj zog tiv thaiv kab mob tau
English: However, the disease can cause serious health problems in adults, infants, and teens, as well as those who are pregnant or have a weakened immune system

English: However, a person who has never had chickenpox or has never received the varicella vaccine can get chickenpox from someone who has shingles

English: Although public water systems are not required to test for manganese, some Minnesota community public water systems test for manganese either before or after treating water

Hmong: Txhob Raug Tsim Txom, Tsis Saib Xyuas, thiab Siv

Hmong: Txhob siv kev tsim txom ua lus cem, rau siab ntsws, rau cev nqaij chaw mos, los sis lub cev, ntaus, los sis cais tawm uas tsis yeem
English: Not use verbal, mental, sexual, or physical abuse, corporal punishment, or involuntary seclusion;

Hmong: Txhua lub chaw tu kho kev mob tsis nchav, thiab txhua lub chaw tu kho uas siv tshaj ob tus neeg los muab kev pab kho hlwb kho siab ntsws rau neeg mob sab nraud yuav tsum muaj lawv ib txoj txheej txheem kev rau taug vim tsis txaus siab uas, tsawg kawg nkaus, teev qhia seb kom yuav tau ua li cas mus ntxiv; qhia tias muab sijhawm hov ntev, nrog rau sijhawm kom lub chaw tu kho teb paub; xyuas kom tus neeg mob tau kev pab los ntawm ib tug neeg pab txhawb; kom teb ntawv rau cov lus sau kev tsis txaus siab; thiab kom muaj ib qho kev txiav txim raws sijhawm los ntawm ib tug neeg txiav txim tsis tuaj leej twg tog yog ho hais tsis sib haum txog qhov kev tsis txaus siab.
English: Every nonacute care facility, and every facility employing more than two people that provides outpatient mental health services shall have a written internal grievance procedure that, at a minimum, sets forth the process to be followed; specifies time limits, including time limits for facility response; provides for the resident to have the assistance of an advocate; requires a written response to written grievances; and provides for a timely decision by an impartial decision maker if the grievance is not otherwise resolved

English: Every acute care in-patient facility, every residential program as defined in Section 7, and every facility employing more than two people that provides out-patient mental health services shall have a written internal grievance procedure that, at a minimum, sets forth the process to be followed; specifies time limits, including time limits for facility response; provides for the patient to have the assistance of an advocate; requires a written response to written grievances; and provides for a timely decision by an impartial decision-maker if the grievance is not otherwise resolved

English: Every patient shall also be free from nontherapeutic chemical and physical restraints, except in fully documented emergencies, or as authorized in writing after examination by a patients� physician for a specified and limited period of time, and only when necessary to protect the patient from self-injury or injury to others.
